answers.answer: First of all, are you a diabetic. You may not be getting enough circulation to your feet. Also people with diabetes have alot of feet problems. I would check into that. Just a suggestion. If you haven't been diagnosed, then I would check into it. My dad is a severe diabetic and he has to be very careful with his feet. One cut on his toe can lead to major infections.

Hi there- I have a blood clotting disorder, and take coumadin/warfarin to control it.  One of the weird "rare" side effects is something called 'purple toes'.  That was actually the second thing that I thought of.  The first was a clot in the vein that is obstructing blood flow to your feet.  When I have a DVT (clot in my leg) I get this really terrible aching at night.  I know that hormones can increase your chances of getting a blood clot.  Not to completely alarm you, but it's worth getting checked out.

question: I am 50 years old.Full hystorectomy at 42 years. Use Vit. supplement "Vascofem" instead of hormone replacement Therapy for last 3 years.Vascofem Copies Estrogen. (Contains natural ingredients and Vit. C.)Lately have a thick vericose vein on the side of my knee which sometimes are painfull, especially at night.A few days ago my two big toe-nails suddenly went blue and feels cold.Looks like blood under the nail. What is wrong?
title: Two big toe-nails suddenly blue,feels cold.
